org.jtrim.access

Class AccessManagers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.access.AccessManagers

  • public final class AccessManagers
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class containing static convenience methods for AccessManagers. Methods generally deal with cases where only read or only write rights are required.
    See Also:
    AccessTokens

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • tryGetReadAccess

        public static <IDType,RightType> AccessResult<IDType> tryGetReadAccess(AccessManager<IDType,? super RightType> manager,
                                                       IDType requestID,
                                                       java.util.Collection<? extends RightType> rights)
        Tries to acquire the requested read rights and returns immediately if it cannot be acquired without waiting.

        This method only saves the caller from the need to manually instantiate an AccessRequest with no write rights requested.

        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the request ID
        RightType - the type of the rights that can be managed by the AccessManager
        Parameters:
        manager - the AccessManager from which the AccessToken is requested. This argument cannot be null.
        requestID - the ID used to identify this request (see AccessRequest.getRequestID()). This argument cannot be null.
        rights - the read rights to be acquired. This argument cannot be null but can be an empty collection.
        Returns:
        the AccessToken if the request could be granted or the list of AccessTokens that needed to be shutted down before the request can be granted. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments are null
        See Also:
        AccessManager.tryGetAccess(AccessRequest)

      • tryGetWriteAccess

        public static <IDType,RightType> AccessResult<IDType> tryGetWriteAccess(AccessManager<IDType,? super RightType> manager,
                                                        IDType requestID,
                                                        java.util.Collection<? extends RightType> rights)
        Tries to acquire the requested write rights and returns immediately if it cannot be acquired without waiting.

        This method only saves the caller from the need to manually instantiate an AccessRequest with no read rights requested.

        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the request ID
        RightType - the type of the rights that can be managed by the AccessManager
        Parameters:
        manager - the AccessManager from which the AccessToken is requested. This argument cannot be null.
        requestID - the ID used to identify this request (see AccessRequest.getRequestID()). This argument cannot be null.
        rights - the write rights to be acquired. This argument cannot be null but can be an empty collection.
        Returns:
        the AccessToken if the request could be granted or the list of AccessTokens that needed to be shutted down before the request can be granted. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments are null
        See Also:
        AccessManager.tryGetAccess(AccessRequest)

      • getScheduledReadAccess

        public static <IDType,RightType> AccessResult<IDType> getScheduledReadAccess(AccessManager<IDType,? super RightType> manager,
                                                             IDType requestID,
                                                             java.util.Collection<? extends RightType> rights)
        Returns an AccessToken which has the requested read rights and will execute tokens after all conflicting AccessTokens have been shutted down. This method returns immediately without waiting with an AccessToken to which tasks can be scheduled to but these tasks will not be executed until there are active conflicting AccessTokens (AccessTokens not yet shutted down).

        This method only saves the caller from the need to manually instantiate an AccessRequest with no write rights requested.

        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the request ID
        RightType - the type of the rights that can be managed by the AccessManager
        Parameters:
        manager - the AccessManager from which the AccessToken is requested. This argument cannot be null.
        requestID - the ID used to identify this request (see AccessRequest.getRequestID()). This argument cannot be null.
        rights - the read rights to be acquired. This argument cannot be null but can be an empty collection.
        Returns:
        the AccessToken if the request could be granted or the list of AccessTokens that needed to be shutted down before the request can be granted. This method never returns null and will always return a non-null AccessToken.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments are null
        See Also:
        AccessManager.getScheduledAccess(AccessRequest)

      • getScheduledWriteAccess

        public static <IDType,RightType> AccessResult<IDType> getScheduledWriteAccess(AccessManager<IDType,? super RightType> manager,
                                                              IDType requestID,
                                                              java.util.Collection<? extends RightType> rights)
        Returns an AccessToken which has the requested write rights and will execute tokens after all conflicting AccessTokens have been shutted down. This method returns immediately without waiting with an AccessToken to which tasks can be scheduled to but these tasks will not be executed until there are active conflicting AccessTokens (AccessTokens not yet shutted down).

        This method only saves the caller from the need to manually instantiate an AccessRequest with no write rights requested.

        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the request ID
        RightType - the type of the rights that can be managed by the AccessManager
        Parameters:
        manager - the AccessManager from which the AccessToken is requested. This argument cannot be null.
        requestID - the ID used to identify this request (see AccessRequest.getRequestID()). This argument cannot be null.
        rights - the write rights to be acquired. This argument cannot be null but can be an empty collection.
        Returns:
        the AccessToken if the request could be granted or the list of AccessTokens that needed to be shutted down before the request can be granted. This method never returns null and will always return a non-null AccessToken.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments are null
        See Also:
        AccessManager.getScheduledAccess(AccessRequest)
